bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Petition.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol 2

div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States for the 9th Circuit, Western District of Washington.
In the Matter of an Application of L.J. Urann for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.} Petition.
To the Honorable, the judges of the Circuit Court of the United States in and for the 9th Circuit Court, Western District of Washington;
The petition of L.J. Urann respectively shows as follows, to-wit:

That the petitioner is unlawfully imprisoned, detained and confined and restrained for his liberty by L.C. Smith, Sheriff of King County Washington and Morris Wolf, Agent of the State of Massachusetts, and that he is confined in prison under the direction of the said L.C. Smith as Sheriff of King County, Washington and Morris Wolf as Agent of the State of Massachusetts, against his will and contrary to the law.

That the said imprisonment, detention and restraint are illegal and that the illegality thereof consists in this, to-wit: That the said petitioner is held without due process of law or any process whatever; that no sufficient warrant or attachment of person has ever been issued out of any court of this State or any other State or Commonwealth of the United States.

That the cause or the pretended cause of the restraint, imprisonment, detention and confinement of said petitioner, to the
best of his knowledge and belief, is a pretended charge of crime alleged to have been committed under the laws of the State of Massachusetts but that said alleged charge is no crime against the law of the State of Massachusetts and that said pretended charge is one of larceny, wherefore in truth and in fact the said charge was laid with spite and founded upon malice and laid for the purpose of extortion and extorting money from the petitioner and that the said charge was made for the purpose of collecting a sum of money due upon a civil debt and that the said complaining witness never had any intention of prosecuting this petitioner for crime but has simply resorted to the process of for the purpose of forcing a collection and not otherwise.
Your petitioner further alleges that his imprisonment is illegal, unjust and in violation of the provisions of the laws of the United States, Sec. 5278 Revised Statutes, in the following particulars:

That this petitioner is not a fugitive from justice from the State of Massachusetts and no demand has been made upon the executive authority of this State by the Govonor of Massachusetts for his apprehension as such, and your petitioner had committed no crime punishable under and by virtue of the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts or the laws of the State of Washington;

That the purported or pretended demand, if any, made upon the Govonor of the State of Washington was not accompanied by a copy of any indictment found against your petitioner, duly certified by the executive authority of the State of Massachusetts to be authentic.
